snippet: The insurance marketplace established under President Obama’s health law has no visible presence in Missouri, which stands out among states resisting the effort.
abstract: Insurance marketplace established under President Obama’s health law has no visible presence in Missouri, which stands out among states resisting the effort; Missouri has refused to create an insurance exchange, forbidden state and local government officials to cooperate with the federal exchange, required insurance counselors to get state licenses before they can help consumers navigate the new insurance markers and, like many states, refused to expand Medicaid.
lead_paragraph: The insurance marketplace established under President Obama’s health law has no visible presence in Missouri, which stands out among states resisting the effort.

headline.main: Missouri Citizens Face Obstacles to Coverage
headline.print_headline: Two States Reflect Divide On Obama’s Health Plan: A Coverage Effort Faces Hurdles in Missouri

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
